Function# bzero

macOS 10.0+

```
void bzero(void *s, size_t n);
```

## [See Also](/documentation/kernel/1579350-bzero#see-also)

### [Memory](/documentation/kernel/1579350-bzero#memory)

[`OSMalloc`](/documentation/kernel/1398447-osmalloc)Allocates a block of memory associated with a given [`OSMallocTag`](/documentation/kernel/osmalloctag).[`OSMalloc_Tagalloc`](/documentation/kernel/1398437-osmalloc_tagalloc)Creates a tag for use with OSMalloc functions.[`OSMalloc_Tagfree`](/documentation/kernel/1398439-osmalloc_tagfree)Frees a tag used with OSMalloc functions.[`OSMalloc_noblock`](/documentation/kernel/1398431-osmalloc_noblock)Allocates a block of memory associated with a given [`OSMallocTag`](/documentation/kernel/osmalloctag), returning `NULL` if it would block.[`OSMalloc_nowait`](/documentation/kernel/1398445-osmalloc_nowait)Equivalent to [`OSMalloc_noblock`](/documentation/kernel/1398431-osmalloc_noblock).[`OSFree`](/documentation/kernel/1398441-osfree)Frees a block of memory allocated by [`OSMalloc`](/documentation/kernel/1398447-osmalloc).[`bzero_phys`](/documentation/kernel/1593364-bzero_phys)
